meanings.definition: The action of expelling a foreigner from a country.
meanings.sent1: The deportations of unauthorized immigrants caused a stir in the community.
meanings.sent2: The government announced a series of deportations of individuals without proper documentation.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the characters joked about organizing a deportation-themed party.
meanings.sent4: The swift deportations of troublemakers kept the city safe.
meanings.sent5: The news coverage of the deportations was intense and emotional.

meanings.definition: The act of transporting someone out of a country for legal reasons.
meanings.sent1: After the trial, the judge ordered the immediate deportations of the criminals.
meanings.sent2: The deportations of convicted felons were carried out by immigration officers.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the comedy scene featured a mix-up leading to mistaken deportations.
meanings.sent4: The idea of deportations in the legal system serves as a deterrent for crime.
meanings.sent5: The documentary shed light on the complexities of international deportations.
